intro: Hippocratea euonymoides, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species. Its rapid growth and vibrant floral display make it a notable addition to gardens and landscapes.
